column4: Hey when I load I get anerror that my x server gui fails to load
is there a way to load in safe mode
no. well, there's recovery mode, but that will just bring you to a console.
just type  sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg  and select the VESA driver, for a safe mode
however... do you have Edgy and third-party nvidia or ati drivers?
I have edgy and ati drivers because I was trying to install beryl
and when did this problem appear? after you rebooted yesterday or such perhaps?
there has been a kernel upgrade, and ati and nvidia drivers won't work anymore unless you update them.
uh, you can't boot? didn't you say that you just couldn't get X started?
server mode?
you aren't on Feisty, are you?
well, see if you can just press Alt+F2 or Alt+F3 and get a "login" prompt, after X doesn't start
if you do, then just type  sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg  and select the VESA driver (as for the rest of the question, press Enter on the defaults)
i told you - just press Enter.
the important one is the selection of the graphics driver (VESA)
I put Ati because I have an ati card.....
no, shouldn't be, since "ati" means you'll use the open-source drivers rather than the (currently broken, it seems) binary drivers
if it still doesn't work, however, try with VESA
err, i'm not at your exclusive service, you know, i'm in a couple of other channels and doing other stuff as well
there ARE defaults. what i told you is to FOLLOW the defaults, EXCEPT for the part where it asks about the driver (that is, the first part). just press Enter at the other questions!
so just select ati and hit ente for everything else?
